results.title: Bluestone
results.brief_description: The prospect of demolition and destruction of several historic bluestone buildings dating back to the 1850s was eventually avoided through public opinion and a resulting classification by the Housing Heritage Trust. This documentary is of great historical value.

results.title: Biscuits by the million
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: This is story of biscuit manufacture in a modern factory of the 50’s. The flour, sugar and milk that forms the basic dough of every biscuit is mixed, kneaded, rolled, stretched and stamped, and ready for final baking in a long oven through which biscuits pass continuously. When cooled they are packed in tins, the only operation carried out by hand. Most of the biscuits are consumed locally, although a percentage are exported to other parts of the world.

results.title: Birth: a film about feelings and experiences
results.creator_credit: Julian Aston, Julian Aston Productions and National Childbirth Trust

results.title: Birth of language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Jay and High Road Productions Inc
results.brief_description: The Birth of Language explores the origin of human language. It examines the differences between human language and animal communication, the relationship of language and thought. The film traces the evolution of humans and their separation from animals.

results.title: Birth of a Florida key
results.brief_description: The origin and growth of the Islets making up the Florida Keys is explained. Mangrove bushes grow with amazing rapidity providing shelter to sea-birds, and assisting in the formation of marine life such as crabs, lobsters, and shell fish, all of which play their part in stabilising the growing islet. Rain helps reduce the salty content of the substratum until it is able to support other forms of plant life besides mangroves. Eventually insects and reptiles are soon represented and the ecological history of the island is complete.

results.title: Birth in the squatting position
results.brief_description: This film shows and discusses the method of giving birth in the squatting position as used in India. Such a position plays a significant role in facilitating labour and delivery, reducing neurological complications in the neonate resulting from birth trauma and in fostering initial maternal-infant attachment. No other credits available.

results.title: Bill Gates: information at your fingertips 2004
results.brief_description: Bill Gates, Chairman and CEO of Microsoft Corporation presents a lecture, delivered in 1994 that predicts the technology and software that will be commonplace in the year 2004. To illustrate his many astoundingly accurate theories, Gates presents a fictional film that anticipates the extensive use of the Internet at home and work, mini-computers facilitating financial transactions checking and transferring funds, teleconferencing in cars enhancing communication for mobile workers, electronic maps providing expedient routes for drivers and the everyday use of email. School students will use the Internet for assignments, downloading images and text, presenting sophisticated graphics in class. In the medical arena, ambulance workers will scan injuries, ascertaining advice from doctors and nurses who download patient’s medical history and personal details. Gates forecasts that even the most minor business will have a website, and that at home entertainment will be re-shaped by interactive television and on-line activities such as gambling. He also envisages problematic issues such as privacy, copywriting information and images on the net, and concerns surrounding the sharing of information. Gates recognises the need for high-speed networks and integrated hardware that familiarises people and businesses with an array of hi-tech activities. An illuminating lecture.
